contextId.information: Yahweh means his punishment is like a yoke around their necks. It is something that will bring down the pride of the rich. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: from which you will not remove your necks

contextId.information: Yahweh is saying in 3:6 these false prophets will no longer receive God's message to the people of Israel. Prophets sometimes got messages from God through visions, or dreams at night. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: it will be night for you ... the day will be dark on them

contextId.information: The people of the nations will go to the mountain of Yahweh like a stream flows. This mean that many people will go. AT: "the people of the nations will flow like a stream to it" or "the people of the nations will go to it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh uses this phrase to emphasize that the people of Jerusalem are supposed to guard and care for all the other people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
God will use the people of Zion to punish the people of the nations. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Arise and thresh, daughter of Zion

contextId.information: Here defeating the Assyrians is spoken of as if it were herding sheep. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: They will shepherd the land of Assyria

contextId.information: AT: "He will come and save us from our enemies. It will be like bringing a person in the dark into the light" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: He will bring me to the light
